Dear Hans,

have a look at JExample, it extends JUnit with first-class depe=
ndencies. You can declare 
@Depends(...) which is taken into account when r=
unning the test graph. Tests may have 
return values even, which are inject=
ed as parameter to dependent tests.

http://www.iam.unibe.ch/~scg/Research/=
JExample/

cheers,
Adrian


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "hans_schwaebli" =
<hans_schwaebli@...> wrote:
>
> I now think that test dependencies are a go=
od idea.
> 
> Does JUnit 4.x support such dependencies, or if not, is it pl=
anned for
> a certain JUnit release to be added?
> 
> For example, if the l=
ogin test did not work, than all other tests
> cannot work. They depend on =
the login test. If login test fails, the
> other tests are not executed.
>
=
